newsitem.title: USA: UPS says has deal to end Teamsters' strike.
newsitem.headline: UPS says has deal to end Teamsters' strike.

text.p: United Parcel Service said on Monday it had reached a tentative agreement on a contract with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters to end the Teamsters' 15-day strike.
In a recorded telephone message at its headquarters in Atlanta, Georgia, UPS said: "This evening, we reached a tentative agreement with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters."
UPS said that under an agreement with Labor Secretary Alexis Herman no details of the tentaive deal would be immediately announced on Monday.
Herman was to announce the tentative agreement at a late-night news conference in Washington following marathon talks between the company and the Teamsters.
